ECComboBox 
  public ECComboBox()
ECComboBox 
  public ECComboBox(int x,
                    int y,

createBorder 
  protected Border createBorder()
Returns the border drawn around the quiescent combo box. You never call this method, but you might override it to use a different border in a subclass. This default implementation returns BezelBorder.loweredBezel().
createDropButton 
  protected Button createDropButton()
Returns the button that drops down the combo box's menu. The button is sized correctly but not yet placed. You never call this method, but you might override it to customize the button's appearance in a subclass. This default implementation returns a new bordered Button with the scroll-down image.
createListView 
  protected ListView createListView()
Returns the list view in the active combo box. The list view is not yet sized or placed. You never call this method, but you might override it to customize the list view's appearance in a subclass. This default implementation returns a new ListView.
createScrollGroup 
  protected ScrollGroup createScrollGroup()
Returns the scroll group in the active combo box. The scroll group is not yet sized or placed. You never call this method, but you might override it to customize the scroll group's appearance in a subclass. This default implementation returns a new ScrollGroup.
createTextField 
  protected TextField createTextField()
Returns the text field of the combo box. The text field is not yet sized or placed. You never call this method, but you might override it to customize the text field's appearance in a subclass. This default implementation returns a new borderless TextField.

setFont 
  public void setFont(Font newFont)
Sets the font of the list view's prototype item and the text view to newFont. This has no effect on list items already in the list, so generally you should call this just after the combo box is created, while it's still empty.

textField 
  public TextField textField()
The combo box's text field. An object that has made itself the owner of the combo box might need this so it can check which text field is sending them messages.
